thread.title: Kelly: Blue Jays’ playoff hopes fade along with R.A. Dickey’s knuckleball
thread.title_full: Kelly: Blue Jays’ playoff hopes fade along with R.A. Dickey’s knuckleball

author: CATHAL KELLY
title: Kelly: Blue Jays’ playoff hopes fade along with R.A. Dickey’s knuckleball
text:
Toronto Blue Jays centre fielder Kevin Pillar reacts after the Kansas City Royals score a run during Game 4 of the ALCS on Oct. 20. (Fred Lum/The Globe and Mail) Kelly: Blue Jays’ playoff hopes fade along with R.A. Dickey’s knuckleball CATHAL KELLY TORONTO — The Globe and Mail 
Published Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015 10:36PM EDT 
Last updated Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015 10:41PM EDT 
R.A. Dickey often describes his knuckleball in terms reserved for a mystical experience. On some game days, it appears. On others, it remains unseen and obscure. 
Also, like God, it has a cruel sense of humour. 
On Tuesday, in the biggest game of his career, Mr. Dickey could not properly conjure his only weapon. The result was his worst outing in three years as a Blue Jay and a humiliating 14-2 loss. Never miss out
